name: Freedom Gauntlet
description:
"Plot"

You're currently serving a prison sentence for a crime you committed. There is however an alternative to serving your time. Taking part in the Freedom Gauntlet game show where prisoners gets a chance to win their freedom by beating challenging courses for the public's entertainment.

Features

  • 30 levels
  • A lot of jumping
  • A lot of dying
  • And that's pretty much it ;)

Hardware Requirements

CPU: Any X64 processor should work
GPU: Any GPU from this century
RAM: 128 Megabytes

Credits

Everything - Jonathan Öhlund (jonathan.ohlund@gmail.com)

Including but not limited to

  • Gameplay
  • Engine
  • Physics
  • Renderer
  • "Graphics"
  • UI
  • Music
  • Data Compression/Storage/Packing
  • Level Editor/Design

Tools

  • Guitar Pro
  • Audacity

Controls

Keyboard

Navigating the Config Menu (The First Screen)

  • Navigate the Options  ->  W/S or the Up/Down Arrow Key
  • Modify/Select Current Option  ->  Space or Enter

Navigating the Profile Menu

  • Change Profile and New Profile Name  ->  WASD or the Arrow Keys
  • Select Profile and Accept New Profile Name  ->  Space or Enter
  • Remove New Profile Name Letter  ->  Q or Backspace
  • Cancel New Profile and Exit Menu   ->  Escape (ESC)

Character Movement

  • Move Left/Right  ->  A/D or the Left/Right Arrow Key
  • Jump  ->  Space or Enter
  • Crouch  ->  S or the Down Arrow Key
  • Stand Up  ->  Crouching  +  W or the Up Arrow Key
  • Grab Pipe  ->  W or the Up Arrow Key
  • Climb Pipe  ->  WASD or the Arrow Keys
  • Jump from Vertical Pipe  ->  A/D or the Left/Right Arrow Key  +  Jump
  • Drop from Vertical Pipe  ->  Lowest Part of a Vertical Pipe  +  S or the Down Arrow Key
  • Drop from Horizontal Pipe  ->  S or the Down Arrow Key
  • Toggle Audio  ->  M
  • Exit to Desktop  ->  Escape (ESC)  +  Q

Xbox Controller

Navigating the Config Menu (The First Screen)

  • Navigate the Options  ->  Up/Down on the DPad or the Left Analog Stick
  • Modify/Select Current Option  ->  A, B, X, Y Buttons

Navigating the Profile Menu

  • Change Profile and New Profile Name  ->  DPad or the Left Analog Stick
  • Select Profile and Accept New Profile Name  ->  A or B Buttons
  • Remove New Profile Name Letter  ->  X or Y Buttons
  • Cancel New Profile and Exit Menu  ->  Start/Menu Button

Character Movement

  • Move Left/Right  ->  Left/Right on the DPad or the Left Analog Stick
  • Jump  ->  The A, B, X, Y Buttons
  • Crouch  ->  Down on the DPad or the Left Analog Stick
  • Stand Up  ->  Crouching  +  Up on the DPad or the Left Analog Stick
  • Grab Pipe  ->  Up on the DPad or the Left Analog Stick
  • Climb Pipe  ->  DPad or the Left Analog Stick
  • Jump from Vertical Pipe  ->  Left/Right on the DPad or the Left Analog Stick  +  Jump
  • Drop from Vertical Pipe  ->  Lowest Part of a Vertical Pipe  +  Down on the DPad or the Left Analog Stick
  • Drop from Horizontal Pipe  ->  Down on the DPad or the Left Analog Stick
  • Toggle Audio  ->  Right Shoulder Button
  • Exit to Desktop  ->  Left Shoulder Button  +  Start/Menu Button
